channel.title: Ban on Driving
channel.description:
I saw this on the news earlier.. and well its absolutely crazy. Once I find an article, or anyone else does I'll add it to the OP but basically here's what's going on:
In some state (I can't think of it off the top of my head) the governor has BANNED driving for the day due to a "fierce storm". He say's that anyone caught driving will be given (I'm not sure on the specifics) about a 1 year jail term and I think a 500 dollar fine, either that or it's a choice. I know he's only doing it for safety precautions, but isn't it crazy that he would ban driving? Seems a little harsh, but thats just me. Some of you feel the ban needs to be put in place due to peoples stupidity, and I agree.
heres the first article on google: [url=http://www.infowars.com/government-bans-driving-during-snowstorm/]http://www.infowars.com/government-bans-driving-during-snowstorm/[/url]

Heres a few pictures from my widow

http://imgur.com/FgcT6KX,CPMupuB,XPbcHOS,MVUSsMg,uSkNByI,nosqf6F,NqDrJgV,QIqPxVH#0

[/quote]
It is not that bad, it would melt away quite fast.[/quote]
Yea if it was warm enough…

its not in my area, the storm. but its quite cold where i live here recently due to the time of year

Is it more than me that are sick of this long winter?

item.title: Ban on Driving
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Kodiak, post:9, topic:482154”][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=600394.msg4216841#msg4216841 date=1360380820]

You guys throw around unconstitutional like it was Superman. I think you have a weak case as this is a state decision and justified.
Kodiak: Comedy Central covered it yesterday.

Well the storm must have been going on longer then I thought, my apologies. I saw it just not long ago. And it’s just because I don’t think it’s right to ban driving. I mean come on.

sometimes people need to be protected from themselves and you act like its permanent when its just for during the storm
[/quote]

read the op i said only for the storm duration

edit: bowser its in the 20inch area, i think?[/quote]
If you feel cold, feel free to visit Norway. Not as much snow where I live and around -5[sup]o[/sup] C in the day time.

Read full topic
